articles.title: drug lord Caro Quintero and 28 meet with Trump team
articles.description: Mexico has sent drug lord Rafael Caro Quintero, who was behind the killing of a U.S. DEA agent in 1985, to the United States with 28 prisoners requested by the U.S. government, a Mexican government official and other sources said Thursday.
articles.content:
In this image released by the FBI shows the wanted posted for Rafael Caro Quintero. (FBI via AP, File)

articles.title: On Ukraine, Trump changed the conversation
articles.description: Trump's arrival in the White House marked the real beginning of a real effort to end the war in Ukraine. Under President Joe Biden, it was going nowhere.
articles.content:

articles.author: Sky News
articles.title: Inside the Oval Office with Donald Trump and Keir Starmer
articles.description: "I've never been into the Oval Office and had a situation where a president would answer so many questions from journalists," Sky's political editor Beth Rigby says.
articles.content:
Wow. That was a lot.
I had two tactics going in: one - smile at Donald Trump, try to catch his eye because then he might ask you for a question, and I did get called.
And two, wear something bright so he sees you in the sea of grey. Well, that worked... [1741 chars]

articles.title: No 10 will think this US trip could not have gone better
articles.description: There seemed to be a genuine rapport between Sir Keir Starmer and Donald Trump, who seemed amenable to the UK prime minister even though they are so different.
articles.content:
With Donald Trump, it's all about relationships.

articles.title: Pentagon mandates removing transgender troops in 30 days
articles.description: The Pentagon ordered U.S. military services to identify transgender members for removal within 30 days as part of a controversial executive order by President Trump.
articles.content:
The military services have 30 days to set procedures for removing transgender troops.
